title: Governor-General of New Zealand
summary: The governor-general of New Zealand[n 1] (Māori: te kāwana tianara o Aotearoa) is the viceregal representative of the monarch of New Zealand, currently Queen Elizabeth II. As the Queen is concurrently the monarch of 14 other Commonwealth realms and lives in the United Kingdom,[n 2] she, on the advice of her New Zealand prime minister, appoints a governor-general to carry out her constitutional and ceremonial duties within the Realm of New Zealand.
